org.ossnipes.snipes.lib.irc
Class EventArgs

java.lang.Object
  org.ossnipes.snipes.lib.irc.EventArgs

public class EventArgs
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper class for arguments to Snipes events.

Constructor Summary
EventArgs()
          Constructs a event arguments object with no keys.
EventArgs(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> args)
          Creates a EventArgs object with the specified arguments as it's parameters.
EventArgs(java.lang.String[] keys, java.lang.String[] values)
          Converts the two specified arrays and uses the keys array as the keys for the parameters, and uses the values array as the values of the Strings of the keys array with the same index.
 
Method Summary
 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeySet()
          Gets all the keys in this args set.
A common use of this would be:

for (String s : args.getKeySet()) {
someList.add(args.getParam(s));
}

 Which would add all the values in the args set to someList (or whatever list you replaced it with.)
 java.lang.Object getParam(java.lang.String key)
          Gets the parameter with the specified key.
 java.lang.String getParamAsString(java.lang.String key)
          Retrieves a event parameter as a String, using the Object.toString() method (so that it is more typesafe than casting to a String).
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

EventArgs

public EventArgs()
Constructs a event arguments object with no keys.

EventArgs

public EventArgs(java.lang.String[] keys,
                 java.lang.String[] values)
Converts the two specified arrays and uses the keys array as the keys for the parameters, and uses the values array as the values of the Strings of the keys array with the same index.

Parameters:
keys - An array of keys, must be the same size as values.
values - An array of values, must be the same size as keys.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If keys.length != values.length or if keys ==null || values == null.

EventArgs

public EventArgs(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> args)
Creates a EventArgs object with the specified arguments as it's parameters.

Parameters:
args - The String Object map of the arguments.
Method Detail

getParam

public java.lang.Object getParam(java.lang.String key)
Gets the parameter with the specified key.

Returns:
The value of the parameter. Null if there's no mapping.

getKeySet

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeySet()
Gets all the keys in this args set.
A common use of this would be:

for (String s : args.getKeySet()) {
someList.add(args.getParam(s));
}

 Which would add all the values in the args set to someList (or whatever list you replaced it with.)

Returns:
A set of all the keys in the args set.

getParamAsString

public java.lang.String getParamAsString(java.lang.String key)
Retrieves a event parameter as a String, using the Object.toString() method (so that it is more typesafe than casting to a String). This is just a convenience method, and is the same as getParam(String).toString().

Parameters:
key - The key to retrieve the value of.
Returns:
The value of the parameter with the specified key.
